A location entity refers to a specific place, geographical area, or location name mentioned in the text. For example, "New York," "the Eiffel Tower," or "the Pacific Ocean" are all location entities. Although he loved the energy and excitement of the city, he often missed the quiet, peaceful life of Greenville. One day, he received a letter from the Greenville theater inviting him to perform in their upcoming production. Without hesitation, John packed his bags and returned to his beloved hometown.
